text:
On tap at Pegs. Originally reviewed 3/13/2015.
Bright green and hazy. Looks great.

Smell is bright citrus. Distinctly tangerine. Light acidity and bread.

Taste has the same intense tangerine. Very nice. Orange and light tartness. Simple, but tasty.

Light and well carbonated.

Simple and delicious.

Draft... Pegs Cantina Barrel Aged Beer Day  TBBW 2015 Cloudy lime-colored pour with a minimal, fizzy, white head thats gone faster than you can say quick. Looks a lot like Fantome Strange Ghost. The aroma is a blend of lime, vanilla and tangerine zest. Light to medium-bodied with a watery mouthfeel and faint carbonation. The flavor is basically watered-down notes of tangerine and lime. Its tart, but more thin and watery than anything else. Pretty good, but I was hoping for a lot more.

On draft at Cycle. How did I forget to rate this one?? Pours a deep green color with a white head. Nose is citrus, tangerine, orange, and light tartness. Flavor is mildly acidic with some citrus, tangerine, and lacto. Light to medium in body with lingering citrus and tartness into the finish.

Yeah its green. Bright green. But its freaking delicious too. Just sour enough with a crap ton of tangerine and green apple notes. Maybe even a hint of melon. Man oh man could I drink a ton of this during the summer.
On tap at Pegs for Barrel Day 15. Funky green pour. Sour citrus bouquet. Taste follows suit. Watermelon?? Good body and mouthfeel. Light and refreshing.

pour from a big CaN that some were calling something i dont remember .. . green as slimer from ghostbusters .. a bit muddly on the mouth, yet super refreshing .. . light and fruity, only complaint is its not as clean as i would have hoped . still excellent .. . . Yes, he moves very quickly for an overstuffed and unlikely Egyptian Pharaoh

Crowler shared by Shadbow, bright green color and small white head. Awesome, aroma is tart, citrus and tropical fruit notes. Taste has a great fruity flavor and juicy, tart, and sour blend of great flavors. A wonderful beer!

Crowler thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy neon green with small off white head that diminishes nothing. The aroma is strong tangerine and wheat. Thin mouthfeel with light tart, wheat, and tangerine. Really enjoyed this.
Growler at weekly tasting. Pours lime green white head. Nose/taste of orange peel, tangerine, key lime (probably by suggestion), sour wheat and sour banana. Lighter medium body. Awesome.
Can growler pour. Hazy green colored with some white lace. Tangerine and citrus, tart and fruit tones.
Beer Bloggers Conference - San Diego - Not my flavor of beer. This was a green monster and full of huge Berliner weisse aromas and flavors.
At The Common Table with Jacob, Justin, and Cody. Pours murky hazy seaweed green. Aroma is light wheat, fresh floral. Taste is taste is sparkly lemonade wheat. Pretty nice.
best color ever. and i could easily drink this all summer. a great weisse.
Really damn good! So green! Excellent sweet and tart balance! So freaking great!
Bright green. Nose is perspiration, sour wheat, kumquat?, clementines. Taste is slightly tart clementines, sour wheat. Light crisp mouthfeel.

Pours bright green with a thin white head. Aroma of orange, lemon, lime and sour wheat. Taste follows, its insane how much this tastes like those hiC ecto coolers. This brings me back yet with a Berliner attached to it. Awesome!

Poured a slimmer green color with aromas of light citrus, sour wheat and a touch of lacto. Flavors are light wheat, tangerines, light citrus and some sourness. Light, refreshing I could drink this all day and the next.
